üîí Fix RLS Policies for Forms

‚ö†Ô∏è Row Level Security (RLS) Issues

Form submission errors are often caused by Row Level Security policies blocking database operations.

Common symptoms:
  • ‚Ä¢ "new row violates row-level security policy" error
  • ‚Ä¢ Forms submit but data doesn't save
  • ‚Ä¢ "permission denied" errors in console
  • ‚Ä¢ Empty tables even after successful submissions

üö® Quick Fix (Development)

Fastest solution:

  1. 1. Go to Supabase Dashboard
  2. 2. Database ‚Üí Tables
  3. 3. Click table name
  4. 4. Toggle "Enable RLS" OFF
  5. 5. Test forms again

‚ö†Ô∏è Only for development!

üîß Proper Fix (Recommended)

Create proper policies:

  1. 1. Use SQL commands provided
  2. 2. Run in Supabase SQL Editor
  3. 3. Create permissive policies
  4. 4. Test form submissions
  5. 5. Adjust policies as needed

‚úÖ Safe for production

üß™ Testing Steps

After applying fixes:

  1. 1. Run /diagnose-forms
  2. 2. Test /admin/applications/new
  3. 3. Test /admin/services/new
  4. 4. Check browser console
  5. 5. Verify data in Supabase

üéØ Confirm everything works

üéØ Expected Outcome

After applying the fixes, you should be able to:

  • ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Add new applications without errors
  • ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Edit existing applications successfully
  • ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Add new services without errors
  • ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Edit existing services successfully
  • ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ See data immediately in admin lists
  • ‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ No console errors during form submission
